member.name: M:MMALSharp.Components.IComponent.AcquireComponent
member.summary: Acquire a reference on a component. Acquiring a reference on a component will prevent a component from being destroyed until the acquired reference is released (by a call to mmal_component_destroy). References are internally counted so all acquired references need a matching call to release them.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.Components.IComponent.ReleaseComponent
member.summary: Release a reference on a component Release an acquired reference on a component. Triggers the destruction of the component when the last reference is being released.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.Components.IComponent.DestroyComponent
member.summary: Destroy a previously created component Release an acquired reference on a component. Only actually destroys the component when the last reference is being released.

member.name: T:MMALSharp.Components.MMALIspComponent
member.summary: This component wraps the ISP (Image Sensor Processor) hardware block to offer hardware accelerated format conversion and resizing. It has one input port taking Bayer, YUV or RGB images in numerous different formats. It has two output ports: Port 361 supports various RGB and YUV formats. Port 362 is off the low res resizer which can only downscale.Due to this port 362 must be at a lower resolution to port 361. If set to a higher resolution then the port will effectively be disabled and no ouput produced.It also doesn't have the colour conversion block, and so only supports YUV formats. https://github.com/raspberrypi/firmware/blob/master/documentation/ilcomponents/isp.html

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class that can be used to change the size and the pixel format of resulting frames.

member.param: The user defined output port type.

member.name: T:MMALSharp.Components.MMALOverlayRenderer
member.summary: MMAL provides the ability to add a static video render overlay onto the display output. The user must provide unencoded RGB input padded to the width/height of the camera block size (32x16). This class represents a video renderer which has the ability to overlay static resources to the display output.

member.summary: A reference to the current stream being used in the overlay.

member.summary: The parent renderer which is being used to overlay onto the display.

member.summary: The configuration for rendering a static preview overlay.

member.name: F:MMALSharp.Components.MMALOverlayRenderer.AllowedEncodings
member.summary: A list of supported encodings for overlay image data.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of a Overlay renderer component. This component is identical to the class, however it provides the ability to overlay a static source onto the render overlay.
member.param: The parent renderer which is being used to overlay onto the display.
The configuration for rendering a static preview overlay.
A reference to the current stream being used in the overlay.

member.summary: Updates the overlay by sending the specified buffer as new image data.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALComponentBase.AcquireComponent
member.summary: Acquire a reference on a component. Acquiring a reference on a component will prevent a component from being destroyed until the acquired reference is released (by a call to mmal_component_destroy). References are internally counted so all acquired references need a matching call to release them.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALComponentBase.ReleaseComponent
member.summary: Release a reference on a component Release an acquired reference on a component. Triggers the destruction of the component when the last reference is being released.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALComponentBase.DestroyComponent
member.summary: Destroy a previously created component Release an acquired reference on a component. Only actually destroys the component when the last reference is being released.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALComponentBase.EnableComponent
member.summary: Enable processing on a component.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALComponentBase.DisableComponent
member.summary: Disable processing on a component.

member.param: The name of the component to create.
member.returns: A pointer to the new component struct.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.IBuffer.Acquire
member.summary: Acquire a buffer header. Acquiring a buffer header increases a reference counter on it and makes sure that the buffer header won't be recycled until all the references to it are gone.

member.summary: Release a buffer header. Releasing a buffer header will decrease its reference counter and when no more references are left, the buffer header will be recycled by calling its 'release' callback function.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALBufferImpl.Acquire
member.summary: Acquire a buffer header. Acquiring a buffer header increases a reference counter on it and makes sure that the buffer header won't be recycled until all the references to it are gone.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALBufferImpl.Release
member.summary: Release a buffer header. Releasing a buffer header will decrease its reference counter and when no more references are left, the buffer header will be recycled by calling its 'release' callback function.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALBufferImpl.Reset
member.summary: Reset a buffer header. Resets all header variables to default values.

member.summary: This class provides an interface to the Raspberry Pi camera module.

member.summary: Gets the singleton instance of the MMAL Camera. Call to initialise the camera for first use.

member.name: P:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.Camera
member.summary: Reference to the camera component.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.StartCapture(MMALSharp.Ports.Outputs.IOutputPort)
member.summary: Begin capture on one of the camera's output ports.

member.summary: Stop capture on one of the camera's output ports.
member.param: An output port of the camera component.

member.summary: Force capture to stop on a port (Still or Video).

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.TakeRawVideo(MMALSharp.Handlers.IVideoCaptureHandler,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Self-contained method for recording raw video frames directly from the camera's video port. Uses the encoding and pixel format as set in and .
member.param: The video capture handler to apply to the encoder.
A cancellationToken to signal when to stop video capture.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.TakeVideo(MMALSharp.Handlers.IVideoCaptureHandler,System.Threading.CancellationToken,MMALSharp.Config.Split)
member.summary: Self-contained method for recording H.264 video for a specified amount of time. Records at 30fps, 25Mb/s at the highest quality.
member.param: The video capture handler to apply to the encoder.
A cancellationToken to signal when to stop video capture.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.TakeRawPicture(MMALSharp.Handlers.IOutputCaptureHandler)
member.summary: Self-contained method to capture raw image data directly from the Camera component - this method does not use an Image encoder. Note: We cannot use the OPAQUE encoding format with this helper method, the capture will not fail, but will not produce valid data. For reference, RaspiStillYUV uses YUV420.
member.param: The image capture handler to use to save image.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.TakePicture(MMALSharp.Handlers.IOutputCaptureHandler,MMALSharp.Common.MMALEncoding,MMALSharp.Common.MMALEncoding)
member.summary: Self-contained method for capturing a single image from the camera still port. An MMALImageEncoder component will be created and attached to the still port.
member.param: The image capture handler to apply to the encoder component.
The image encoding type e.g. JPEG, BMP.
The pixel format to use with the encoder e.g. I420 (YUV420).

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.TakePictureTimeout(MMALSharp.Handlers.IFileStreamCaptureHandler,MMALSharp.Common.MMALEncoding,MMALSharp.Common.MMALEncoding,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Self-contained method for capturing a continual images from the camera still port for a specified period of time. An MMALImageEncoder component will be created and attached to the still port.
member.param: The image capture handler to apply to the encoder component.
The image encoding type e.g. JPEG, BMP.
The pixel format to use with the encoder e.g. I420 (YUV420).
A cancellationToken to trigger stop capturing.
When enabled, burst mode will increase the rate at which images are taken, at the expense of quality.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALCamera.TakePictureTimelapse(MMALSharp.Handlers.IFileStreamCaptureHandler,MMALSharp.Common.MMALEncoding,MMALSharp.Common.MMALEncoding,MMALSharp.Config.Timelapse)
member.summary: Self-contained method for capturing timelapse images. An MMALImageEncoder component will be created and attached to the still port.
member.param: The image capture handler to apply to the encoder component.
The image encoding type e.g. JPEG, BMP.
The pixel format to use with the encoder e.g. I420 (YUV420).
A Timelapse object which specifies the timeout and rate at which images should be taken.

member.summary: Configure the exposure mode used by the camera.

member.summary: Configure the exposure metering mode to be used by the camera. The metering mode determines how the camera measures exposure.

member.summary: Configure the Auto White Balance to be used by the camera.

member.summary: Configure any image effects to be used by the camera

member.summary: Allows a user to change the colour of an image, e.g. U = 128, V = 128 will result in a greyscale (monochrome) image.

member.summary: Specify the rotation of the image, possible values are 0, 90, 180, 270.

member.summary: Specify whether the image should be flipped.

member.name: P:MMALSharp.MMALCameraConfig.ROI
member.summary: Zoom in on an image to focus on a region of interest.

member.name: P:MMALSharp.MMALCameraConfig.ShutterSpeed
member.summary:
Changing the shutter speed alters how long the sensor is exposed to light (in microseconds).
There's currently an upper limit of approximately 6.000.000s (6.000ms, 6s), past which operation is undefined. 8MP Sony sensor supports 8s max shutter speed.

member.name: P:MMALSharp.MMALCameraConfig.AwbGainsR
member.summary: Adjust auto white balance 'red' gains.

member.name: P:MMALSharp.MMALCameraConfig.AwbGainsB
member.summary: Adjust auto white balance 'blue' gains.

member.name: P:MMALSharp.MMALCameraConfig.DrcLevel
member.summary:
Adjust dynamic range compression.
DRC changes the images by increasing the range of dark areas, and decreasing the brighter areas. This can improve the image in low light areas.

member.name: P:MMALSharp.MMALCameraConfig.StatsPass
member.summary: Displays the exposure, analogue and digital gains, and AWB settings used.

member.name: M:MMALSharp.MMALConnectionImpl.Destroy
member.summary: Destroy a connection. Release an acquired reference on a connection. Only actually destroys the connection when the last reference is being released. The actual destruction of the connection will start by disabling it, if necessary. Any pool, queue, and so on owned by the connection shall then be destroyed.
